isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION (9200/9300/ 9400 MODELS WITH PRO SLEEPER, AFTER MAY 1997)

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION (9200/9300/ 9400 MODELS WITH PRO SLEEPER, AFTER MAY 1997)

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 83 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

figure.caption: Figure 83. 92/93/9400 With Pro Sleeper (After May 1997) Cab Air Suspension

svcprocinfo.para: The cab air suspension system for the 9200, 9300 and 9400 models with Pro Sleeper (after May 1997) contains two air springs (bags) (Item 15), two shock absorbers (Item 9), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 1). The air suspension assembly needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (Items 22 and 24), fittings (Item 26), air springs (Item 15), height control valve (Items 1 or 29), shock absorbers (Item 9) and lateral control arm (Item 27) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve, air springs (bags) and shock absorbers are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para: Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and connections. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of components.

svcsubproc.title: Height Control Valve - Remove

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve ( Item 1 or 29, Figure 83), it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 84for Items in parentheses.

calloutgroup.callout1: 7. DRIVE BEARING NOTCH FOR VALVE ORIENTATION
11. AIR LINE COMPRESSION NUT (TIGHTEN HAND TIGHT + 1 TURN)

step1.para: Disconnect air bag air lines (Item 1) from the "Y" push-in connectors (Item 2) in the "SUSP" port of the height control valve (Item 3). Disconnect the air supply air line (Item 4) from the push-in elbow connector (Item 5) in the SUPPLY port of the height control valve.
Disconnect the fixed height control valve linkage (Item 6) from the height control valve lever (Item 9).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 83 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before June 1997, remove height control valve (Item 1) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 4 and 5) securing the height control valve to the valve bracket (Item 2).
After June 1997, remove height control valve (Item 29) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 4 and 5) securing the height control valve to the cab mounting bracket (Item 19).

Inspect the height control valve to insure drive bearing notch is located on the "SUPS" port side of valve. If not, loosen lever screw, but not remove, and pull lever loose from drive bearing and rotate drive bearing until the drive bearing notch is in the correct position, then secure lever by tightening lever screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 in-lbs. (4.5 to 5.6 Nm).
Before June 1997, position the height control valve on the valve bracket, and secure it with hex bolts and hex lock nuts. Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 Nm).

note.para: When replacing a height control valve on a suspension built before June 1997, the air line, fittings and fasteners will also need to be replaced. Consult directions in the valve service kit.

step1.para: After June 1997, position the height control valve on the cab mounting bracket, and secure it with hex bolts and hex lock nuts. Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 Nm).

After June 1997, position the height control valve so the drive bearing notch is located on the "SUSP" port side of the valve. Then place it on the cab mounting bracket and secure it with hex bolts and hex lock nuts. Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 Nm).

Connect the air bag air lines into the "Y" push-in connectors in the "SUSP" port of the height control valve. Connect the air supply air line into the push-in elbow connector in the SUPPLY port of height control valve.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.
Check cab height between the bottom of the cab mounting bracket and the top of the crossmember mounting bracket. Cab air suspension ride height is fixed and should be 6-1/2 inches ( Figure 85).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 83 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove shock absorbers (Item 9) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 10 and 11) at the top and bottom of the shock absorber.
Remove shock absorbers (Item 9) from between the cab mounting bracket (Item 19) and crossmember mounting bracket (Item 12).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber - Install

step1.para: Position shock absorbers in place between the cab mounting bracket and crossmember mounting bracket.
Install hex bolts and hex lock nuts at the top and bottom of the shock absorbers. Tighten to 40 to 50 ft-lbs. (54 to 68 Nm).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag) - Remove

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 83 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Push in on the fitting collars (Item 26) and remove air lines (Items 21 and 23) from the air springs (bags) (Item 15).
Remove the retaining ring (Item 20) from the stud at the top of the air springs (bags) (Item 15).

Screw the air springs (bags) (Item 15) off the threaded stud (Item 28) on the crossmember mounting bracket (Item 12), then slide the air springs (bags) from between the cab mounting bracket (Item 19) and crossmember mounting bracket.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag) - Install

step1.para: Place the air springs (bags) in position between the cab mounting bracket and crossmember mounting bracket.
Position the air springs (bags) on the threaded studs and then screw down until the bottom is tight against the crossmember mounting bracket.
Install the retaining ring at the top of the air springs (bags) and securely press onto top stud of the air springs (bags).
Screw the push-in fittings into the air springs (bags); make sure they connect properly. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Push the air lines into the push-in fittings at the top of the air springs (bags).
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.
Check cab height between the bottom of the cab mounting bracket and the top of the crossmember mounting bracket. Cab air suspension ride height is fixed and should be 6-1/2 inches ( Figure 85).
